# December 2025

<div class="entry">
<div class="entry-date">02 Dec 2025</div>
<div class="entry-title">Figure 2 Fixes & Jackknife <span class="tag tag-fix">Fixed</span></div>
<div class="entry-desc">
Resolving the "Never Treated" interaction issue. The bug: "High" variable was defined as missing for never-treated units, dropping them from interaction regressions. The fix: Define high=0 among NTs and remove interaction with year effects.
</div>
<a href="https://maowens.quarto.pub/jk_code_review/" class="entry-link">View Jackknife Code Review</a>
</div>

# November 2025

<div class="entry">
<div class="entry-date">25 Nov 2025</div>
<div class="entry-title">Robustness & JJP Comparison <span class="tag tag-analysis">Analysis</span></div>
<div class="entry-desc">
Decision: Run Fig 1 among bottom 10% baseline spending counties. JJP's Figure 1 uses PSID-linked districts (~10% of districts, selected for low income). JJP Appendix B2 shows smaller effects closer to our findings.
</div>
<a href="https://maowens.quarto.pub/jackknife/" class="entry-link">View Analysis</a>
</div>

<div class="entry">
<div class="entry-date">17-21 Nov 2025</div>
<div class="entry-title">District & Panel Analysis <span class="tag tag-analysis">Expansion</span></div>
<div class="entry-desc">
Hypothesis: Aggregating to county level smooths variation across districts, potentially leading to smaller effects than JJP. Sample balanced on non-missing lexp_ma_strict from event times -5 to 17.
</div>
<a href="https://maowens.quarto.pub/district_and_top_100/" class="entry-link">District Level Results</a>
<a href="https://maowens.quarto.pub/balanced-panel-event-study-analysis/" class="entry-link">Balanced Panel Results</a>
</div>

<div class="entry-date">06 Nov 2025</div>

# October 2025

<div class="entry">
<div class="entry-date">31 Oct 2025</div>
<div class="entry-title">The Mixed County Problem <span class="tag tag-bug">Complex Data</span></div>
<div class="entry-desc">
Issue: Lack of school-age population data for non-tracted areas. If a county has >1 non-tracted area, weighting is impossible. Fix: Combine all non-tracted areas in a county into a single pseudo-area.
</div>
</div>

<div class="entry">
<div class="entry-date">28 Oct 2025</div>
<div class="entry-title">Defining Good Counties <span class="tag tag-decision">Decision</span></div>
<div class="entry-desc">
A "Good County" is one where every linked tract/LEAID has non-missing spending data for every year from 1966-1971. Created indicator variables good_county_6671 to filter samples.
</div>
</div>

<div class="entry">
<div class="entry-date">24 Oct 2025</div>
<div class="entry-title">Baseline Year Selection</div>
<div class="entry-desc">
Findings: 1971 vs. 1966-70 average yields similar results. Decision: Use 1971 on its own or average across several years as robustness check.
</div>
<a href="https://maowens.quarto.pub/10_24_25-b397/" class="entry-link">View Notes</a>
</div>

<div class="entry">
<div class="entry-date">21 Oct 2025</div>
<div class="entry-title">Pre-Quartile Splits</div>
<div class="entry-desc">
Goal: Compare individual pre-quartile splits (e.g., 1967 vs 1971) to ensure single-year spikes aren't driving results.
</div>
<a href="https://maowens.quarto.pub/10_21_25-da7b/" class="entry-link">View Notes</a>
</div>

<div class="entry">
<div class="entry-date">17 Oct 2025</div>
<div class="entry-title">Interpolation & Winsorizing <span class="tag tag-decision">Methodology</span></div>
<div class="entry-desc">
Method: Winsorize all spending values at 1st and 99th percentiles within year. Refinement: Interpolate at district level before tract-to-county processing.
</div>
<a href="https://maowens.quarto.pub/10_17_25/" class="entry-link">View Notes</a>
</div>

<div class="entry">
<div class="entry-date">11 Oct 2025</div>
<div class="entry-title">Common Core & Balancing</div>
<div class="entry-desc">
Data Update: Incorporated Common Core spending data through 2018-19. Balancing: Redefined lead_5 to bin all earlier years; lag_17 bins all later years. Exclude counties treated 2000+.
</div>
<a href="https://maowens.quarto.pub/10_10_25/" class="entry-link">View Notes</a>
</div>

<div class="entry">
<div class="entry-date">07 Oct 2025</div>
<div class="entry-title">Debugging pred_spend <span class="tag tag-bug">Debug</span></div>
<div class="entry-desc">
Challenge: Event studies by pred_spend went in opposite directions than expected. Action: Step-by-step reconstruction from simple event study to baseline quartile split to pred_spend construction.
</div>
<a href="https://maowens.quarto.pub/10_7_25/" class="entry-link">View Notes</a>
</div>

# September 2025

<div class="entry">
<div class="entry-date">30 Sep 2025</div>
<div class="entry-title">Reform Variables <span class="tag tag-decision">Decision</span></div>
<div class="entry-desc">
Decision: Build pred_spend without reforms to isolate variable issues.
</div>
<a href="https://maowens.quarto.pub/9_30_25/" class="entry-link">View Notes</a>
</div>

<div class="entry">
<div class="entry-date">23 Sep 2025</div>
<div class="entry-title">Wisconsin Binning Fix <span class="tag tag-fix">Fixed</span></div>
<div class="entry-desc">
Bug: Coefficients for lead 16-19 were empty, but lead 20 was non-empty. Cause: Binning issue in estimation.
</div>
<a href="https://maowens.quarto.pub/9_23_25/" class="entry-link">View Notes</a>
</div>

<div class="entry">
<div class="entry-date">02 Sep 2025</div>
<div class="entry-title">Hanushek vs. JJP</div>
<div class="entry-desc">
Action: Re-run First Stage Approach 1 using only JJP reform info to ensure replication.
</div>
<a href="https://maowens.quarto.pub/jjp_first_stage/" class="entry-link">View Notes</a>
</div>

# August 2025

<div class="entry">
<div class="entry-date">26 Aug 2025</div>
<div class="entry-title">Data Cleaning <span class="tag tag-data">Data</span></div>
<div class="entry-desc">
Imputation: Imputed 1986 enrollment using 1987 numbers for district 3416800. Zero Values: For 1983 enrollment==0, replaced with 1984 or 1982 values.
</div>
</div>

<div class="entry">
<div class="entry-date">19 Aug 2025</div>
<div class="entry-title">JJP Methodology Deep Dive</div>
<div class="entry-desc">
Difference: JJP uses district-level; we use county-level. Variable definitions include current year spending weighted by 1972 pop, log average PPE over 13-year rolling window, and log average PPE over available data.
</div>
</div>

<div class="entry">
<div class="entry-date">01 Aug 2025</div>
<div class="entry-title">The PPE Formula <span class="tag tag-analysis">Math</span></div>
<div class="entry-desc">
Calculating Per Pupil Expenditures for split tracts. Formula: (PrimaryPPE * PrimaryShare) + (SecondaryPPE * SecondaryShare)
</div>
</div>

# July 2025

<div class="entry">
<div class="entry-date">29 Jul 2025</div>
<div class="entry-title">Duplicate Tracts <span class="tag tag-fix">Fixed</span></div>
<div class="entry-desc">
Issue: Tracts appearing multiple times for elementary and secondary. Resolution: Reshape to tract level with separate variables for elementary/secondary districts.
</div>
</div>

<div class="entry">
<div class="entry-date">15 Jul 2025</div>
<div class="entry-title">Geographic Challenges</div>
<div class="entry-desc">
Issue: Difficulty mapping districts to counties via tracts. Strategy: If population weighting fails, default to centroids. Match failures assigned to counties via GRF.
</div>
</div>

<div class="entry">
<div class="entry-date">11 Jul 2025</div>
<div class="entry-title">Project Kickoff</div>
<div class="entry-desc">
Goal: Produce panel of per-pupil spending at the county level. Rationale: We only observe birth location at the county level.
</div>
</div>
